00058 /*
00059  *      The internal symbol table structure is implementation
00060  *      specific. In this implementation, a symbol table is
00061  *      implemented as a hash table.
00062  *
00063 \*===========================================================================*/
00064 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00065 #include <config.h>
00066 #include <stdio.h>
00067 #include <string.h>
00068 #include <stdlib.h>
00069 #include <malloc.h>
00070 #include <library/symbol.h>
00071 
00072 /* print error message and punt. */
00073 static void
00074 error (char *mesg)
00075 {
00076   fprintf (stderr, "symbol table library error : %s\n", mesg);
00077   exit (-1);
00078 }
00079 
00080 /* allocate space for a string and duplicates a string */
00081 char *
00082 StrSave (char *str)
00083 {
00084   int i, len;
00085   char *new_str;
00086   len = strlen (str);
00087   new_str = (char *) malloc (len + 1);
00088   if (new_str == 0)
00089     {
00090       fprintf (stderr, "# StrSave # lack of space\n");
00091       exit (-1);
00092     }
00093   for (i = 0; i <= len; i++)
00094     new_str[i] = str[i];
00095   return new_str;
00096 }
00097 
00098 #define MAX     100             /* at most 100 symbol tables */
00099 
00100 typedef struct _SymTbl
00101 {
00102   Symbol array;                 /* symbol array */
00103   int size;                     /* table size */
00104 }
00105 _SymTbl, *SymTbl;
00106 
00107 static _SymTbl TBL[MAX];        /* symbol tables */
00108 static int next_tbl = 0;        /* next symbol table */
00109 
00110 /* Compute the hash address. Return a number between 0 and size. 
00111  * Hash either the symbol is found, or when an INVALID_SYMBOL
00112  * is found.
00113  */
00114 static int
00115 Hash (SymTbl tbl, char *name, int type)
00116                 /* symbol table */
00117                 /* symbol name */
00118                 /* symbol type */
00119 {
00120   Symbol table;
00121   int length, key;
00122   register int hash_size, hash_pos, increment, trial;
00123   /* Quadratic probing */
00124   /* 1: initialize hash table parameters */
00125   table = tbl->array;
00126   hash_size = tbl->size;
00127   /* 2: compute initial hash position */
00128   length = strlen (name);
00129   key =
00130     (type * 377) + (name[0] * 23) + (name[length] * 12) + (name[length / 2]);
00131   hash_pos = key % hash_size;
00132   /* 3: iterate until exit condition is met */
00133   increment = 1;
00134   for (trial = 0; trial < hash_size; trial++)
00135     {
00136       /* 4: test if there is a hit */
00137       if ((table[hash_pos].type == type) &&
00138           !strcmp (table[hash_pos].name, name))
00139         {
00140           return hash_pos;
00141         }
00142       else
00143         /* 5: test if there is a miss */
00144       if (table[hash_pos].type == INVALID_SYMBOL)
00145         {
00146           return hash_pos;
00147         }
00148       /* 6: else rehash */
00149       hash_pos = (hash_pos + increment) % hash_size;
00150       increment++;
00151     }
00152   /* went into a recursive loop, apparently the table
00153    * is not designed correctly.
00154    */
00155   fprintf (stderr, "# symbol table size = %d\n", hash_size);
00156   fprintf (stderr, "# number of hash steps = %d\n", trial);
00157   error ("symbol: too many hash steps");
00158   return -1;
00159 }
00161 int
00162 NewSymTbl (int max_size)
00163 {
00164   int new_id, i;
00165   SymTbl T;
00167   new_id = next_tbl++;
00168   if (new_id >= MAX)
00169     {
00170       error ("symbol: run out of symbol tables");
00171       return -1;
00172     }
00173   T = TBL + new_id;
00174   T->size = max_size;
00175   T->array = (Symbol) malloc (sizeof (_Symbol) * T->size);
00176   if (T->array == 0)
00177     {
00178       error ("symbol: failed to allocate symbol table array");
00179       return -1;
00180     }
00181   for (i = 0; i < T->size; i++)
00182     {
00183       T->array[i].name = 0;
00184       T->array[i].type = INVALID_SYMBOL;
00185       T->array[i].value = 0;
00186       T->array[i].ptr = 0;
00187     }
00188   return new_id;
00189 }
00191 void
00192 ClearSymTbl (int tbl_id)
00193 {
00194   register int i;
00195   SymTbl T = TBL + tbl_id;
00196   if ((tbl_id < 0) || (tbl_id > next_tbl))
00197     error ("symbol: in ClearSymTbl: illegal tbl_id");
00198   for (i = 0; i < T->size; i++)
00199     {
00200       T->array[i].name = 0;
00201       T->array[i].type = INVALID_SYMBOL;
00202       T->array[i].value = 0;
00203       T->array[i].ptr = 0;
00204     }
00205 }
00206 /* BCC -  Clear a symbol table and free its ptr fields - 8/17/96 */
00207 void
00208 ClearFreeSymTbl (int tbl_id, void (*free_xxx) (void *))
00209 {
00210   register int i;
00211   SymTbl T = TBL + tbl_id;
00212   if ((tbl_id < 0) || (tbl_id > next_tbl))
00213     error ("symbol: in ClearSymTbl: illegal tbl_id");
00214   for (i = 0; i < T->size; i++)
00215     {
00216       if (T->array[i].name)
00217         free (T->array[i].name);
00218       T->array[i].name = 0;
00219       T->array[i].type = INVALID_SYMBOL;
00220       T->array[i].value = 0;
00221       if (T->array[i].ptr)
00222         free_xxx (T->array[i].ptr);
00223       T->array[i].ptr = 0;
00224     }
00225 }
00227 Symbol AddSym (int tbl_id, char *name, int type)
00228 {
00229   int index;
00230   SymTbl tbl = TBL + tbl_id;
00231   Symbol sym;
00232   if ((tbl_id < 0) || (tbl_id > next_tbl))
00233     error ("symbol: in FindSym: illegal tbl_id");
00234   index = Hash (tbl, name, type);
00235   sym = tbl->array + index;
00236   /* create a new symbol if necessary */
00237   if (sym->type == INVALID_SYMBOL)
00238     {
00239       sym->name = StrSave (name);
00240       sym->type = type;
00241       sym->value = 0;
00242       sym->ptr = 0;
00243     }
00244   return sym;
00245 }
00247 Symbol FindSym (int tbl_id, char *name, int type)
00248 {
00249   int index;
00250   SymTbl tbl = TBL + tbl_id;
00251   Symbol sym;
00252   if ((tbl_id < 0) || (tbl_id > next_tbl))
00253     error ("symbol: in FindSym: illegal tbl_id");
00254   index = Hash (tbl, name, type);
00255   sym = tbl->array + index;
00256   /* if not found, return 0 */
00257   if (sym->type == INVALID_SYMBOL)
00258     return 0;
00259   else
00260     return sym;
00261 }
00262 
00263 #ifdef DEBUG
00264 void
00265 pr (Symbol sym)
00266 {
00267   if (sym == 0)
00268     fprintf (stderr, "()\n");
00269   else
00270     fprintf (stderr, "(%s %d %d %d)\n",
00271              sym->name, sym->type, sym->value, sym->ptr);
00272 }
00273 void
00274 main ()
00275 {
00276   int id, *XXX;
00277   char *YYY;
00278   void *ZZZ;
00279   struct
00280   {
00281     int a, b;
00282   }
00283    *AAA;
00284   Symbol s;
00285   fprintf (stderr, "#####\n");
00286   id = NewSymTbl (7);
00287   s = AddSym (id, "aaa", 1);
00288   pr (s);
00289   s = FindSym (id, "aaa", 2);
00290   pr (s);
00291   s = AddSym (id, "bbb", 2);
00292   pr (s);
00293   s = FindSym (id, "bbb", 2);
00294   pr (s);
00295   s = AddSym (id, "ccc", 2);
00296   pr (s);
00297   s = AddSym (id, "ddd", 2);
00298   pr (s);
00299   s->ptr = XXX;
00300   s = AddSym (id, "ddd", 2);
00301   pr (s);
00302   s = AddSym (id, "eee", 2);
00303   pr (s);
00304   s = FindSym (id, "eee", 1);
00305   pr (s);
00306   s = AddSym (id, "fff", 2);
00307   pr (s);
00308   s->ptr = (Symbol) YYY;
00309   s = AddSym (id, "fff", 2);
00310   pr (s);
00311   s->ptr = (Symbol) ZZZ;
00312   s = AddSym (id, "fff", 2);
00313   pr (s);
00314   s->ptr = (Symbol) AAA;
00315   s = FindSym (id, "fff", 2);
00316   pr (s);
00317   s = AddSym (id, "ggg", 2);
00318   pr (s);
00319   s = AddSym (id, "hhh", 2);
00320   pr (s);
00321   fprintf (stderr, "#####\n");
00322 }
00323 #endif
